greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = Sum_{d|n} (-1)^(n/d+1)*tau(d), where tau = number of divisors (A000005).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
formula: Multiplicative with a(2^e) = (e+1)*(2-e)/2, and a(p^e) = (e+1)*(e+2)/2 for an odd prime p. - _Amiram Eldar_, Oct 25 2020
mathematica: nmax = 85; Rest[CoefficientList[Series[Sum[DivisorSigma[0, k] x^k/(1 + x^k), {k, 1, nmax}], {x, 0, nmax}], x]]
nmax = 85; Rest[CoefficientList[Series[Log[Product[(1 + x^k)^(DivisorSigma[0, k]/k), {k, 1, nmax}]], {x, 0, nmax}], x] Range[0, nmax]]
f[p_, e_] := If[p == 2, (e + 1)*(2 - e)/2, (e + 1)*(e + 2)/2]; a[1] = 1; a[n_] := Times @@ (f @@@ FactorInteger[n]); Array[a, 100] (* _Amiram Eldar_, Oct 25 2020 *)
results.author: _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Aug 23 2018
